alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 6:35AM EDT until further notice by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... Barton River Near Coventry affecting Orleans County. For the Lake Memphremagog...including Coventry...Record flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Record flooding is occurring and record flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Barton River near Coventry. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Maple Street and River Road between Orleans and Coventry Station will flood. There will be extensive field and lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 10.3 feet, which is a record for this gage. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM EDT Tuesday was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.5 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.3 feet on 08/29/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EDT.
